articles.author: RTÉ News
articles.title: Coronavirus: 24 hours around the world in pictures
articles.description: Over a 24-hour period, in a world where a third of humanity is now under orders to stay home, photographers have captured snapshots of daily life during the coronavirus pandemic.
articles.content:
Over a 24-hour period, in a world where a third of humanity is now under orders to stay home, photographers have captured snapshots of daily life during the coronavirus pandemic.
From Paris to Santa Monica, Dhaka to Panama, life has shuddered to a halt in va… [+4482 chars]

articles.author: RTÉ News
articles.title: Daily Mirror and Mail predict coronavirus financial hit
articles.description: The publishers of the Daily Mail and Daily Mirror newspapers both flagged expected financial hits from the coronavirus crisis today, saying advertising and other revenue would be weakened.
articles.content:
The publishers of the Daily Mail and Daily Mirror newspapers both flagged expected financial hits from the coronavirus crisis today, saying advertising and other revenue would be weakened.

articles.author: RTÉ News
articles.title: Dixons Carphone warns on profit due to coronavirus
articles.description: UK electricals retailer Dixons Carphone has warned it would not meet its previous guidance for 2019-20 profit and debt due to the coronavirus emergency which has forced the closure of its stores in Ireland, the UK and Greece.
articles.content:
UK electricals retailer Dixons Carphone has warned it would not meet its previous guidance for 2019-20 profit and debt due to the coronavirus emergency which has forced the closure of its stores in Ireland, the UK and Greece.

articles.title: Explainer: How coronavirus is transmitted
articles.content:
There are 1,564 confirmed cases of coronavirus in Ireland with nine deaths attributed to the disease.
Worldwide, there have been more than 447,000 confirmed cases and 20,599 deaths.
